intro: Vaccinium consanguineum var. irazuense, commonly known as the Irazú variant of the common huckleberry, is a shrub native to the highlands of Costa Rica. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acidic soil-tolerant plants. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible and often used in local cuisine. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to volcanic soils. Its botanical features include evergreen leaves and a compact growth habit.
